net.fec.openrq.encoder

Interface SourceBlockEncoder


  • public interface SourceBlockEncoder
    An encoder for a source block.

    A source block encoder is retrieved from a DataEncoder object, which is associated to some source data. Source data is divided into source blocks and each source block is independently encoded by an instance of this interface. The source block being encoded is divided into source symbols, which together with repair symbols (extra encoded data) form the encoding symbols. The encoding symbols are transmitted inside encoding packets to a RaptorQ decoder (as specified in RFC 6330).

    A source block can be encoded by an instance of this interface, independently from other source blocks, and the block is identified by a source block number, which is carried inside an encoding packet. The method sourceBlockNumber() provides the source block number that identifies the source block being encoded. Additionally, the number of source symbols into which the source block is divided is given by the method numberOfSourceSymbols().

    The method encodingPacket(int) returns an encoding packet with a specific encoding symbol. The methods sourcePacketsIterable() and repairPacketsIterable(int) return iterable objects that iterate over all source packets (encoding packets with a source symbol each) and over some repair packets (encoding packets with a repair symbol each). More customizable iterable objects can be created using the SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder
      A builder class for an Iterable over EncodingPacket instances.

        the data encoder object from which this source block encoder was retrieved

        the source block number for the source block being encoded

        int numberOfSourceSymbols()
        Returns the total number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded.
        Returns:
        the total number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded

      • encodingPacket

        EncodingPacket encodingPacket(int esi)
        Returns an encoding packet with an encoding symbol from the source block being encoded. The symbol is a source or a repair symbol according to the provided identifier.

        More specifically, if we have sbn as the source block number for the source block being encoded, then this method returns an encoding packet with an encoding symbol identified by <sbn, esi>.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ 0
        • esi ≤ max_esi
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the encoding symbol in the returned packet
        Returns:
        an encoding packet with an encoding symbol from the source block being encoded
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid
        See Also:
        sourceBlockNumber(), numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • sourcePacket

        EncodingPacket sourcePacket(int esi)
        Returns an encoding packet with a source symbol from the source block being encoded.

        More specifically, if we have sbn as the source block number for the source block being encoded, then this method returns an encoding packet with a source symbol identified by <sbn, esi>.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ 0
        • esi < K
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the source symbol in the returned packet
        Returns:
        an encoding packet with a source symbol from the source block being encoded
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid
        See Also:
        sourceBlockNumber(), numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • sourcePacket

        EncodingPacket sourcePacket(int esi,
                          int numSymbols)
        Returns an encoding packet with multiple source symbols from the source block being encoded.

        More specifically, if we have sbn as the source block number for the source block being encoded, then this method returns an encoding packet with:

        • a 1st source symbol identified by <sbn, esi>,
        • a 2nd source symbol identified by <sbn, esi+1>,
        • a 3rd source symbol identified by <sbn, esi+2>,
        • etc.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ 0
        • esi < K
        • numSymbols > 0
        • numSymbols ≤ (K - esi)
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first source symbol in the returned packet
        numSymbols - The number of source symbols to be placed in the returned packet
        Returns:
        an encoding packet with multiple source symbols from the source block being encoded
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier or the number of symbols are invalid
        See Also:
        sourceBlockNumber(), numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • repairPacket

        EncodingPacket repairPacket(int esi)
        Returns an encoding packet with a repair symbol from the source block being encoded.

        More specifically, if we have sbn as the source block number for the source block being encoded, then this method returns an encoding packet with a repair symbol identified by <sbn, esi>.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ K
        • esi ≤ max_esi
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the repair symbol in the returned packet
        Returns:
        an encoding packet with a repair symbol from the source block being encoded
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid
        See Also:
        sourceBlockNumber(), numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • repairPacket

        EncodingPacket repairPacket(int esi,
                          int numSymbols)
        Returns an encoding packet with multiple repair symbols from the source block being encoded.

        More specifically, if we have sbn as the source block number for the source block being encoded, then this method returns an encoding packet with:

        • a 1st repair symbol identified by <sbn, esi>,
        • a 2nd repair symbol identified by <sbn, esi+1>,
        • a 3rd repair symbol identified by <sbn, esi+2>,
        • etc.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ K
        • esi ≤ max_esi
        • numSymbols > 0
        • numSymbols ≤ (1 + max_esi - esi)
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the first repair symbol in the returned packet
        numSymbols - The number of repair symbols to be placed in the returned packet
        Returns:
        an encoding packet with multiple repair symbols from the source block being encoded
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier or the number of symbols are invalid
        See Also:
        sourceBlockNumber(), numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • newIterableBuilder

        SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder newIterableBuilder()
        Returns a new builder object for an iterable over encoding packets.

        For example, the following code shows how to retrieve an iterable over encoding packets that starts at encoding symbol identifier (ESI) 51 and ends at ESI 100: 

         Iterable<EncodingPacket> iterable = newIterableBuilder().startAt(50)
                                                         .endAt(100)
                                                         .build();
        The resulting iterable can be iterated using a "foreach" loop: 
         for (EncodingPacket packet : iterable) {
   // process packet...
 }
        Returns:
        a new builder object for an iterable over encoding packets

      • sourcePacketsIterable

        Iterable<EncodingPacket> sourcePacketsIterable()
        Returns an iterable over all source packets, each packet containing one source symbol.

        The resulting iterable can be iterated using a "foreach" loop: 

         for (EncodingPacket packet : iterable) {
   // process packet...
 }

        Calling this method is the same as calling: 

         encoder.newIterableBuilder().startAtInitialSourceSymbol()
                             .endAtFinalSourceSymbol()
                             .build();
        Returns:
        an iterable over all source packets
        See Also:
        newIterableBuilder()

      • repairPacketsIterable

        Iterable<EncodingPacket> repairPacketsIterable(int numRepairPackets)
        Returns an iterable over a number of repair packets, each packet containing one repair symbol.

        The resulting iterable can be iterated using a "foreach" loop: 

         for (EncodingPacket packet : iterable) {
   // process packet...
 }

        Calling this method is the same as calling: 

         encoder.newIterableBuilder().startAtInitialRepairSymbol()
                             .endAt(encoder.numberOfSourceSymbols() + numRepairPackets - 1)
                             .build();
        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • numRepairPackets > 0
        • numRepairPackets ≤ (1 + max_esi - K)
        Parameters:
        numRepairPackets - The number of repair packets to iterate
        Returns:
        an iterable over a number of repair packets
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the number of repair packets is invalid
        See Also:
        newIterableBuilder()
